Epoxy Coating for TMT

Protect your building's backbone. Advanced anti-corrosion technology for TMT bars.

Home > Epoxy Coating

Why Coat TMT Bars?

Steel corrosion is the leading cause of concrete structure failure. In coastal cities like Chennai, high humidity and salinity accelerate this process. When steel rusts, it expands, causing cracks and spalling in the concrete.

Fusion Bonded Epoxy (FBE) coating provides a robust, impermeable barrier that prevents moisture, chlorides, and oxygen from reaching the steel surface. This significantly extends the lifespan of your building and reduces future maintenance costs.

The Coating Process

1

Cleaning

Shot blasting to remove rust and mill scale from the TMT bars.

2

Heating

Induction heating of bars to the required temperature (230°C - 250°C).

3

Coating

Electrostatic application of epoxy powder which fuses to the hot steel.

4

Curing

Water quenching to cure the coating and cool the bars for handling.

Performance Specifications

Test Standard Result
Coating Thickness IS 13620 175 - 300 microns
Adhesion ASTM A 775 Pass
Salt Spray Resistance ASTM B 117 > 800 Hours
Flexibility IS 13620 Pass (No Cracking)
